153.Name: DefaultReportPoint
153.Explanation: Where to report to 0=Not set, set to venue number to include in contracts

155.Name: PublicLiability
155.Explanation: If set requires Insurance upload by performers

157.Name: CSSColourDark
157.Explanation: Main Dark Contrast eg for links

164.Name: CSSColourTue, Wed, Thur, Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon
164.Explanation: Colours used for each day of programme

165.Name: CSSColourDayTabBack
165.Explanation: Used as the background for Day tables (above)

169.Name: FooterBack
169.Explanation: Background to the footer, can be colour or an image

170.Name: Procession
170.Explanation: If you want to call it a Parade, set to Parade

171.Name: MultiLimFri (Sat, Sun ...
171.Explanation: Limit dance sides to that number on that day (work in progress)

172.Name: ProcessDays
172.Explanation: Bit map of days with processions bit 1=Fri, 2=Sat, 4=Sun, 8 = Mon

173.Name: DanceNeedAddress
173.Explanation: Is the Address a Needed field

174.Name: DanceOrg
174.Explanation: Dance Organiser(s) to sign off dance emails

175.Name: DanceDefaultSlot
175.Explanation: Sub Event default size for dance

181.Name: DanceNeedPerformers
181.Explanation: If set Number of performers is checked

182.Name: DanceNeedMobile
182.Explanation: If set need a Mobile number

183.Name: DanceNeedDays
183.Explanation: If set need to select at least one day

184.Name: DanceSpecialMessage
184.Explanation: Enables a special message for Dance sides. Value: Messages Name

185.Name: DanceDefaultPerSlot
185.Explanation: Sides per sub event slot default

186.Name: AllDanceTimes
186.Explanation: If set always shows the times for each dance slot.  Not normally needed

187.Name: RestrictOneProcession
187.Explanation: If set, dance sides can only indicate one of the processions

188.Name: DanceEmailsFrom
188.Explanation: Email address Dance emails will have

189.Name: SMTPuser
189.Explanation: Username for sending emails (internal never externally seen)

191.Name: SMPTserver
191.Explanation: Server to send email from (if sending via another server)

192.Name: SMTPsubdomain
192.Explanation: To add a subdomain to the mail address

195.Name: ShowYear
195.Explanation: Festival to show on public pages

196.Name: PlanYear
196.Explanation: Festival to show on staff pages

197.Name: ShortName
197.Explanation: Short acronym for festival – must be set

198.Name: FestLegalName
198.Explanation: Legal name of the festival eg Chippenham Folk Festival C.I.C.

199.Name: FestLegalAddr[]
199.Explanation: The formal address of the festival, have as entries for each line of the address as needed

202.Name: FestName
202.Explanation: Name of Festival e.g. Chippenham Folk Festival

203.Name: HostURL
203.Explanation: URL for the festival eg chippfolk.co.uk

204.Name: FestHomeName
204.Explanation: Name of the festival’s location – eg Chippenham

205.Name: EnableDateChange
205.Explanation: If you have to change date of festival, this enables the messages

206.Name: EnableCancelMsg
206.Explanation: Message to be used on a date change

208.Name: RealFaviconGeneratorKey
208.Explanation: API Key used with Real Favicon Generator

209.Name: LookBackYears
209.Explanation: Number of years to simply look back

210.Name: Camping
210.Explanation: See YearData.php to work out what it does

211.Name: FestVatNumber
211.Explanation: Vat number, if set the festival charges VAT

212.Name: VatRate
212.Explanation: VAT %age to use (if festival has a VAT Number

216.Name: InvoiceLogo
216.Explanation: Logo to be used on invoices

217.Name: FestTresEmail
217.Explanation: Email address Finance emails come from

219.Name: PerformerBanners
219.Explanation: If set, system will attempt making a banner for each side at the top of their performer public page.

220.Name: TopText4Perfs
220.Explanation: If set, the short performers description is added to a @Perf xxx tile on the front page

221.Name: DefaultPageBanner
221.Explanation: Default Banner for top of pages

222.Name: TopBannerScrollRate
222.Explanation: Scroll rate of top banner on top page (in milliseconds)

223.Name: BannerOverlay
223.Explanation: If set allows text over the banner on top page

225.Name: FoodCenter
225.Explanation: Feature number to use a the food map centre

226.Name: LinupShortDesc_Dance, _Music, _Comedy, _Family, _Youth, _Ceilidh, _Other

228.Name: NoEventsPost
228.Explanation: Words to apply when a programme event category is not yet public

229.Name: NotAllPublic
229.Explanation: Enables “These venues have published events, more are coming” on venue list

230.Name: MainMenuTable
230.Explanation: Enables menu from database (should be always 1 now)

231.Explanation: Address to append to http://facebook.com/ in icon bar

232.Name: Twitter
232.Explanation: Address to append to http://X.com/ in icon bar

233.Name: Instagram

234.Name: YouTube
234.Explanation: Address to append to http://YouTube.com/ in icon bar

238.Name: DefaultDirLat
238.Explanation: Default Lat to give directions from

239.Name: DefaultDirLong
239.Explanation: Default Long to give directions from

242.Name: GoogleAPI
242.Explanation: API used when getting directions from Google

243.Name: DirectionDefault
243.Explanation: Name of location where default directions are from

245.Name: SpecialMessage
245.Explanation: Enables a special message for non Dance sides. Value: Messages Name

246.Name: MusicTypes
246.Explanation: Enables the Type field for non-dance performers

249.Name: MusicDefaultPerSlot
249.Explanation: Performers per sub event slot default (not currently used)

250.Name: NeedBandMembers

253.Name: PerformerTickets
253.Explanation: How to handle them: Wimb, Chip (needs explaining)

255.Name: RecordEventChanges

256.Name: RecordPerfChanges
256.Explanation: Record Performer changes to report programme differences

257.Name: FreeText
257.Explanation: Free, Donation, what word(s) to add to an event without a price

259.Name: MailListMgrEmail
259.Explanation: Who to send emails about the mailing list to

260.Name: MailListID
260.Explanation: Mailing List ID as used by Octopus email

261.Name: PerformerPairsExtra
261.Explanation: Default pairs of performers per page

262.Name: OmitEmptyDescriptions
262.Explanation: If set Performers without descriptions will be omitted

263.Name: PaperColouredEvents

265.Name: WebSiteBanner
265.Explanation: Banner at the top of Publicity posters

267.Name: TradeEmail
267.Explanation: Email address Trade emails should come from

268.Name: TradeLastWeek
268.Explanation: Days after sending a quote before showing the “Last week message”

269.Name: TradeUnQuote
269.Explanation: Days after sending last week, before showing “UnQuote Message”

272.Name: InviteBetter
272.Explanation: Enables the “Invite Better” Message for Trade

276.Name: TradeChamberCommerce
276.Explanation: Show Chamber of Commerce Tick Box

279.Name: TradeExtras

281.Name: TraderPasses
281.Explanation: Ask number of Trader Passes wanted

282.Name: TradeCarpark
282.Explanation: Ask number of Car park passes needed

285.Name: TradeOrg

286.Explanation: Copy all out going trade emails to this address as a bcc

289.Name: AutoInvoices
